content:
Adding words to the user dictionary only means they aren't flagged as misspelled by the spell check. They aren't added to the list of suggested spellings.

This has been requested for 17 years: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338291
creator: sfhowes

content:
To sort by tags, first enable the Tags column in Table View, then sorting by tags is available in Table or Cards View.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1428753#answer-1634186

Or, enable Tags under View/Folders so that particular tags can be selected in the Folder Pane. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with View is hidden, or select View from the 3-bar menu icon.
creator: sfhowes

content: Yes, you can do that. - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to profile folder, click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - you are now in the profile. copy the addressbooks, abook.sqlite and history.sqlite to a safe place - POP messages will be in Mail folder, such as inbox and inbox.msf and local folders will be in Mail\Local Folders - Copy everything in the POPaccount folder. - If IMAP accounts, they will regenerate when set up again. - when you have saved all that you want, - uninstall thunderbird - delete c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder this ensures a fresh restart - install thunderbird - set up POP account and exit without downloading messages. - exit thunderbird - copy the saved POP folders to the Mail\<popaccount> folder and the local folders to Mail\Local Folders. You will be prompted for overwrites. Allow - copy the abook.sqlite and the history.sqlite into the root of the profile - start thunderbird and add any IMAP accounts.
creator: davidsk

content: Are all four accounts with same email provider? And you receive same error, regardless of account used? Do you have four separate SMTP servers defined? (You can check that at account settings pane, scroll down left side to 'Outgoing servers (SMTP) and click to view.) Are they all defined identically? Please click 'edit' for one of them and post a screenshot of the contents for review here. This may not be where the solution lies, but much detail is missing from your post. Problems such as you reported are often done where there are too few SMTP servers, or where SMTP settings are incorrect. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I am not aware of a spam tool that looks at raw HTML. However, if there is a header that is interesting, you can add that to the filter. For example, Newsgroups is not a default filter option, but since it is a legitimate header entry, I was successful in creating a filter to run off of it. Another approach is software: mailwasher is free for just one account and does an excellent job of spam management. Another option is to create a gmail account, and import your mail through gmail: that lets you then use gmail's filter tools for your account.
creator: davidsk

content:
I can do this with my own hosted mail server, but means I'll have to import my entire mailbox into a IMAP account and then forward my @hotmail account to it, (I have numerous owned domains).

I have that option! So I'll see if I want to do it.

Thanks for the feedback, but they do need to add this as an option to the filters, and it seems no one else is doing it, so they would be the first, which would be another great reason to use Thunderbird.

Been getting some nasty encoded HTML phishing emails (see attached). No chance of filtering anything due to CSS hidden styles and encoding. I did block the below styles, but apparently legitimate emails do use them, no idea why.

display: none; visibility: hidden; mso-hide: all;

No one should be trying to hide anything in an email, but some companies do, which is annoying!

Ciao. Alla prima domanda non ti saprei rispondere.

Alla seconda invece ti confermo che ho sempre fatto i backup regolarmente con mozbackup. E adesso ho appena provato a ripristinare all'ultima versione del backup ma sembra di avere peggiorato le cose...thunderbird mi propone solo due account (ne ho 5) e mi mostra delle email vecchissime che non so nemmeno da dove possano essere saltate fuori... ti mando screenshot. spero di non aver combinato un guaio... Di buono io ho pochissime email conservate sui server. Me le salvo sempre (quelle importanti) sul pc e cancello le altre. Quindi per me non è un problema aver perso dati perché non ne ho... mi domando infatti come possano essere saltate fuori delle email del 2019...

Cosa potrei fare per avere il programma funzionante? Disinstallare tutto e reimpostar tutti gli account manualmente da zero?

Molte grazie in anticipo per la disponibilità Aurin

content:
L'uso di mozbackup è sconsigliato da anni. Il programma non è più aggiornato dal 2012! Pessima idea anche quella di ripristinare il backup di mozbackup, ti avevo anche invitato a fare il backup secondo la guida ufficiale.

A questo punto, se davvero non hai nulla da perdere, crea un nuovo profilo di Thunderbird come spiegato qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-piu-profili#w_creare-un-profilo e configura gli account che ti servono

Per il momento ti suggerisco di NON cancellare l'attuale profilo di Thunderbird ma affiancare il nuovo.

Hello there

Your mouse may not be responding as it should if you have a separate mouse such as wireless or otherwise you could check to see if your drivers for this device are out of date or simply need to be updated again.

Another subject could also be the culprit.

There could also be another topic that is the culprit, I can suggest you merge this into other related topics almost identical to yours.

By this I mean that I can provide you with a laundry list of solutions.

by this I mean that you should be able to run this list in order to minimize or eliminate this topic from incorrect use with it.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there

Restart the affected app or editor Check for updates

The Thunderbird software check for conflicts with other software. Please try a reset for the Thunderbird app

Restart the device for example. Update the device. Repair or reinstall software Check for malware or viruses Check for conflicts with other programs.

Check for hardware problems.

Check your RAM usage so that you do not experience freeze moments.

Freezing usually returns to the ram using its reaction capabilities.

You may also be causing this due to missing or missed updated devices you are working with.

it could also be a button that you have not switched on, for example. It can also be in a small corner.


Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content:
The gmail smtp has 'normal password' authentication, instead of OAuth2, like the incoming. Remove the smtp:// entry for the account in Saved Passwords in Settings/Privacy & Security, restart TB, send a test message from the gmail account. You might have to enter the account password in an OAuth browser window, although the existing token in Saved Passwords for the incoming should apply to incoming and outgoing.

Consider updating your outlook settings:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1417298#answer-1588949
creator: sfhowes

content: Access the Google calendar in your browser, click the + icon next to 'Other calendars' to add a calendar, 'Browse calendars of interest', Regional holidays, Browse all, select Holidays in United States. In TB, add a new calendar 'On the network', enter your gmail address..., then select the holiday calendar.
creator: sfhowes

content:
It was easy to subscribe to Google's holiday calendar with @fshowes instructions. In case it's not obvious to everyone, here is a more detailed how-to:

  • New Calendar (lower left)
  • On the Network
  • Enter Gmail address as "Username," "Location" automatically fills in as gmail.com
  • Sign-in process (gmail + password + verification)
  • "Create New Calendar" dialog shows available calendars
  • Select the calendar(s) you want.
creator: vknowles

content:
I found it easy to follow the instruction from sfhowes, but in case anyone would like a more detailed how-to:

  • New Calendar (lower left)
  • On the Network
  • Enter Gmail address as "Username," "Location" automatically fills in as gmail.com
  • Sign-in process (gmail + password + verification)
  • "Create New Calendar" dialog displays available calendars
  • Select the calendar(s) you want.
creator: vknowles

content: A possibility: - exit thunderbird - in proflle folder, under the Mail folder, locate your POP account and copy the message folders to the Mail\Local folders folder. You may want to rename to keep them separate from other local folders. - restart thunderbird and verify that the folders are accessible in Local folders. - Now you can delete the POP account - For your protection, whenever doing something such as this, I encourage doing a full backup of the profile when TB is not running to ensure that everything is saved in case a mistake is made.

content: Thunderbird does all of that, has been around for 20+ years, used by 10s of 1,000s, and by many businesses. However, no software can guarantee no problems ever, although I have never had a problem. If you're using as a business, I encourage doing periodic backups, not because Thunderbird is fragile, but because it's for a business. I am amazed at the number of businesses that post here with a problem and have years of data lost because they never ran backups. Thunderbird is easy to setup. If you have questions at any time, just post them here.
creator: davidsk

Thanks for the response. OUTLOOK was a years ago problem long forgotten by never gotten over. I have people that "back up" but who is to say they do what they are paid to do? Is there someone knowledgeable that does this sort of set up/maintenance/gal or guy Friday that is worth their fare?

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help


You write that you can no longer send outgoing messages.

Try viewing your outgoing server details in your Thunderbird Software.

These settings are set as they are normally set for use.

After an update, some miscommunication could have arisen, resulting in a situation similar to yours.

Together we can see whether this can be completed so that it works as it should again.

Can you send me a screenshot of your outgoing SMTP server settings for email use? This is probably installed in your Thunderbird software on your desktop.


https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-to-make-screenshots


Greetings Firefox volunteer.

We don't have a "Local Files". Do you mean "Local Folders"? These would be only on your machine.

And of course your backup.

content:
If there is a bounce, that is not something you can do in your Thunderbird. The SENDER must fix the problem of why it is not getting through.

That said, it is unlikely anyone can help you solve this problem unless you post the EXACT error mesage the sender is seeing.
